title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about the timing and impacts of the Sunday-Monday nor’easter
author: John Waller
bullets: The National Weather Service predicts heavy snow, strong winds, and coastal flooding for southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island.
Meteorologist forecasts suggest the nor’easter will follow a Track 1 path, potentially leading to significant snowfall in metro Boston.
Power outages are a high concern due to heavy, wet snow and strong winds during the storm from late Sunday to Monday evening.

title: Alex Bregman declines to respond to Sam Kennedy’s comments about player’s Red Sox departure
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman declined to respond to Red Sox president Sam Kennedy's comments on his departure from the team.
Bregman left the Red Sox for the Chicago Cubs, partly due to receiving a no-trade clause in his new contract.
Despite leaving, Bregman praised his time in Boston, appreciating the fans, teammates, and coaching staff.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Apocalypse Now' (Redux) featuring Robert Duvall is streaming on Pluto TV and Plex.
'Blue Moon,' a biopic by Richard Linklater starring Ethan Hawke, is available on Netflix.
Jennifer Garner stars in 'The Last Thing He Told Me' Season 2, now streaming on Apple TV.

title: Red Sox INF Marcelo Mayer has to earn spot on Opening Day roster, Alex Cora says
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora stated Marcelo Mayer must earn his spot on the Opening Day roster this season.
Mayer must improve offensively to secure a starting role, despite his strong defensive and base-running abilities.
Mayer is focusing on second base in spring training, with competition from newcomer Caleb Durbin for an infield role.

title: 7 maps predicting snowfall totals Sunday-Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: Meteorologists predict a nor'easter with heavy snow, strong winds, and coastal flooding for southeast MA and RI Sunday night into Monday.
Predicted snowfall includes a potential foot or more on the South Shore and Cape, affecting metro Boston as well.
Forecast suggests potential power outages due to heavy, wet snow and high winds during the storm's peak Monday.

title: Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lindsay Clancy appeared in-person for court in Duxbury, first appearance since alleged murder of her three children in 2023.
Clancy, 35, faces charges of murder and strangulation; trial logistics discussed for the upcoming July 20 court date.
Clancy's defense plans an insanity plea, citing postpartum mental illness and medication issues as contributing factors.

title: Cape Cod adopts transfer fee on home sales over $1 million
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Barnstable County Assembly of Delegates approved a transfer fee on home sales over $1 million, now heading to state legislature.
The fee could raise up to $60 million annually for housing initiatives, with exemptions for first-time buyers and retirees.
If approved, towns could adopt the measure to fund year-round housing efforts, retaining 90% of revenue locally.

title: Peabody police warn about ‘Northshore Mall takeover’
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Peabody police warn of 'Northshore Mall takeover' scheduled for Friday at 3 p.m., coordinating with local and state agencies.
Events involve large crowds for car stunts, with previous incidents leading to violence and police cruiser damage in various towns.
Gov. Healey issued a $14 million safety grant; Rep. Markey filed legislation for vehicle confiscation and penalties for reckless driving.

title: 7 members of ‘Harvard Street Gang’ face drug and firearms charges, authorities say
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Seven Harvard Street Gang members charged with drug and firearms offenses following federal investigations in Eastern Massachusetts.
Authorities seized 25 firearms, several kilograms of drugs, and over $40,000 in cash from searches across Brockton and Randolph.
Investigation since 2019 led to multiple arrests; gang linked to shootings, drug trafficking, and witness intimidation.

title: Al Horford says his decision to leave Celtics was ‘deeper than just the basketball’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Al Horford left the Celtics for the Golden State Warriors after his second stint, citing deeper reasons than basketball.
Horford spent seven seasons with the Celtics, winning an NBA title, but cited non-basketball issues for his departure.
Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla praised Horford's impact and character, calling him a future Hall-of-Famer after his departure.
